TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AVAudioSessionCategory extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Enumeration defining the various audio categories supported by AVAudioSession.
Docs.remarks: These enumeration values are used with the strongly typed version of methods.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype AVFoundation.AVAudioSessionCategory Ambient = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Use this category if playing audio is not your application's main use and if your application can be used with the sound off. This allows background music to be mixed with the audio your application produces.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype AVFoundation.AVAudioSessionCategory AudioProcessing = int32(5)

Docs.summary: Use this category when you want to use the hardware accelerated audio support to perform audio conversions.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype AVFoundation.AVAudioSessionCategory MultiRoute = int32(6)
.field public static literal valuetype AVFoundation.AVAudioSessionCategory PlayAndRecord = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Used to perform both playback and recording at the same time, for example for live chat applications.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype AVFoundation.AVAudioSessionCategory Playback = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Use this if the main use of your application is to play back music.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype AVFoundation.AVAudioSessionCategory Record = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Used to record audio. This will prevent background audio and messages from playing back.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype AVFoundation.AVAudioSessionCategory SoloAmbient = int32(1)

Docs.summary: This is the default audio session category.
